alert.note: Alert for Northern Westchester; Orange; Putnam; Rockland (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 9:34PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHERN WESTCHESTER...EAST CENTRAL ORANGE...WESTERN PUTNAM AND ROCKLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 1015 PM EDT... At 933 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near West Point, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ossining, Peekskill, Mahopac, West Point, Cold Spring, New Windsor, Yorktown Heights, Kiryas Joel, Stony Point, Jefferson Valley, Putnam Valley, Woodbury, Croton-on-Hudson, Firthcliffe, and Highland Falls. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern New York.
